item.title: Preference Optimization for Review Question Generation Improves Writing Quality
item.description: arXiv:2602.15849v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Peer review relies on substantive, evidence-based questions, yet existing LLM-based approaches often generate surface-level queries, drawing over 50\% of their question tokens from a paper's first page. To bridge this gap, we develop IntelliReward, a ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, paper, arxiv, transformer, API | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Evidence-Grounded Subspecialty Reasoning: Evaluating a Curated Clinical Intelligence Layer on the 2025 Endocrinology Board-Style Examination
item.description: arXiv:2602.16050v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Background: Large language models have demonstrated strong performance on general medical examinations, but subspecialty clinical reasoning remains challenging due to rapidly evolving guidelines and nuanced evidence hierarchies.
